intro: Popowia mortehanii, commonly known as the mountain popowia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, palmate leaves, and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
